metadata.Name: RusTitW
metadata.Description: A dataset for Russian text recognition in the wild, containing 33,533 images with over 100,000 text instances. Images include street signs, ads, and info plates, and are annotated at word and line levels.
metadata.Paper Title: RusTitW: Russian Language Text Dataset for Visual Text in-the-Wild Recognition
Affiliations: Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology (MIPT)
Federal Research Center 'Computer Science and Control' of the Russian Academy of Sciences (FRC CSC RAS)
metadata.Abstract: This paper introduces RusTitW (Russian Text in the Wild), a new publicly available dataset for text recognition in the wild. The dataset contains 33,533 images with more than 100,000 text instances, fully annotated on a word and line level. The images were collected in various conditions and contain a wide range of text types, including street signs, advertisements, and information plates. The dataset is divided into training and test sets, with 26,826 and 6,707 images, respectively. We provide a detailed analysis of the dataset and benchmark several state-of-the-art text recognition models. The dataset is available at https://github.com/SmartEngines/RusTitW.
